intro: Spermacoce laevis, commonly known as the smooth spermacoce, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, smooth, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
